apply_immediately.description: Determines whether modifications to the cluster are applied immediately or during the next maintenance window.

auto_minor_version_upgrade.description: Determines whether minor engine version upgrades are automatically applied during the maintenance window.

availability_zone.description: Specifies the availability zone where the ElastiCache cluster will be created; must match one of the AZs in the region.

az_mode.description: Specifies whether the cluster is created in a single availability zone or across multiple availability zones.

cluster_id.description: Unique identifier for the ElastiCache cluster, required for managing the cluster resources.

engine.description: Specifies the database engine for the Elasticache cluster, such as "redis" or "memcached".

engine_version.description: Specifies the version of the cache engine to be used, must be compatible with the chosen engine type.

final_snapshot_identifier.description: Identifier for the final snapshot to be created when the cluster is deleted. Must be unique and cannot exceed 255 characters.

ip_discovery.description: Specifies the IP discovery method for the cluster, determining how the cluster nodes are accessed and identified.

log_delivery_configuration.description: Configuration specifying the delivery method and destination for Redis engine logs, such as Amazon CloudWatch Logs or Amazon S3.

maintenance_window.description: Specifies the preferred weekly time range for system maintenance, in UTC format (e.g., "sun:23:00-mon:01:30").

network_type.description: Specifies the type of network the cluster will use, such as 'vpc' for Virtual Private Cloud or 'classic' for the EC2-Classic network.

node_type.description: Specifies the instance type for the cache cluster, determining the computational and memory capacity. Must be a valid node type supported by Amazon ElastiCache.

notification_topic_arn.description: ARN of the SNS topic to which notifications will be sent; must be configured in the same AWS account.

num_cache_nodes.description: Specifies the number of cache nodes in the cluster; must be between 1 and 50, depending on the chosen node type.

outpost_mode.description: Determines whether the cluster is created in an Outpost or a standard AWS region; must be set to 'outpost' for Outpost deployments.

parameter_group_name.description: Specifies the name of the parameter group to associate with the ElastiCache cluster, ensuring compatibility with the desired configuration settings.

port.description: Specifies the port number for the cache cluster, typically 6379 for Redis or 11211 for Memcached.

preferred_availability_zones.description: Specifies the availability zones for the cluster, ensuring high availability and fault tolerance; must match the region of the cluster.

preferred_outpost_arn.description: Specifies the ARN of the preferred Outpost for the cache cluster; applicable only when deploying on Outposts.

replication_group_id.description: Specifies the identifier of the replication group to associate the cluster with; must be an existing replication group ID.

security_group_ids.description: List of security group IDs to associate with the ElastiCache cluster, ensuring network access control.

snapshot_arns.description: List of Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) for Redis snapshot files to seed the cluster during creation.

snapshot_name.description: Name of the snapshot to restore from when creating the ElastiCache cluster; must match an existing snapshot in the same region.

snapshot_retention_limit.description: Number of days to retain automatic backups before deletion. Must be a non-negative integer.

snapshot_window.description: Time range (UTC) during which ElastiCache will create a snapshot, must be a non-overlapping window within the backup retention period.

subnet_group_name.description: Specifies the name of the subnet group to associate with the ElastiCache cluster, ensuring it operates within the designated VPC subnets.

tags.description: Key-value pairs to associate with the Elasticache cluster for resource organization and management.

timeouts.description: Defines the amount of time to wait for operations like creation, update, and deletion of the Elasticache cluster.

transit_encryption_enabled.description: Determines whether transit encryption is enabled for the cluster, requiring TLS-enabled connections.
